'''Shimr ibn Ziljushan''' or '''Shimr''' ({{lang-ar| شمر بن ذي الجوشن الضبابي الهوازني}}) was a son of Ziljushan from the tribe of [[Banu Kilab]] ([[Sunni]] belief differs), one of [[Arabia]]'s [[Hawazin|Hawazinite]] [[Qays|Qaysid]] tribes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.al-islam.org/maqtal-al-husayn-abd-al-razzaq-al-muqarram/al-husayn-ashura#8|title=Al-Husayn on ‘Ashura|work=Al-Islam.org|accessdate=20 October 2015}}</ref> [[Umm ul-Banin]], the mother of [[Abbas ibn Ali]], was also from the Banu Kilab tribe. Shimr has a villainous reputation in Shia Islam. He is known as the man who killed Islamic prophet [[Muhammad]]'s grandson [[Hussein ibn Ali]] at the [[Battle of Karbala]].<ref name="slate2013-01-20">{{cite web|url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2013/01/20/obama_depicted_on_a_huge_billboard_in_tehran_iran_next_to_shemr.html|title=Why is President Obama Depicted on a Huge Billboard in Tehran?|author=Daniel Politi|publisher=Slate magazine|date=20 January 2013|accessdate=16 February 2013}}</ref><ref name="guardian2013-01-20">{{cite web|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/shortcuts/2013/jan/20/iran-obama-billboard-tehran-propaganda|title=Iran's Obama billboard: what it really means|publisher=The Guardian|date=20 January 2013|accessdate=16 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alshirazi.com/roaa/readings/imamshirazi/23.htm|title=تسليط الأضواء على هوية الجيش الذي قاتل الحسين؟|work=alshirazi.com|accessdate=20 October 2015}}</ref>
== Death == Shia [[hadith|traditions]] relate that Shimr was eventually killed by [[Mukhtar al-Thaqafi]]'s troops who wished to take revenge upon Husayn and his family's killers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://library.islamweb.net/newlibrary/display_book.php?idfrom=949&idto=949&bk_no=59&ID=1057|title=الكتب - البداية والنهاية - ثم دخلت سنة ست وستين - ذكر مقتل شمر بن ذي الجوشن ، أمير السرية التي قتلت حسينا- الجزء رقم12|work=islamweb.net|accessdate=20 October 2015}}</ref> His body was then torn to pieces by wild dogs.<ref>{{cite book | url=http://www.amazon.com/The-Islamic-Drama-Jamshid-Malekpour/dp/0714684465 | title=The Islamic Drama | publisher=Routledge | date=2 Aug 2004 | author=Malekpour, Jamshid | page=38 | isbn=978-0714684468}}</ref>
== Depiction == Shimr is depicted in the passion plays during the Shia mourning remembrance of [[Day of Ashura|Ashura]].<ref>{{ciook |title=Struggle and Survival in the Modern Middle East |last1=Burke |first1=Edmund |last2=Yaghoubian|first2=Nejde|year= 2006 |publisher=University of California Press |isbn=9780520246614 |page=243 }}</ref>
In January 2013, a huge poster was erected in [[Tehran]], the capital city of [[Iran]] depicting Shimr standing next to U.S. President [[Barack Obama]].<ref name="slate2013-01-20"/><ref name="guardian2013-01-20"/>
